actions.committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 101-454.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 105.
Mr. Bosco moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-367.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: To designate the Federal building located at 777 Sonoma Avenue in Santa Rosa, California, as the "John F. Shea Federal Building".

summary.text: Designates the Federal building located at 777 Sonoma Avenue in Santa Rosa, California, as the "John F. Shea Federal Building."

titles.title: To designate the Federal building located at 777 Sonoma Avenue in Santa Rosa, California, as the "John F. Shea Federal Building".
